value.title: Power Apps - Step by Step Tutorial Guide for Beginners by Dhruvin Shah
value.excerpt: Welcome to Power Apps Beginner Series. This series is dedicated to all Power Apps Beginners. Anyone who wanted to add their first step in Power Apps, they can go through this series. These are Power Apps beginner’s tutorial. The entire Power Apps Beginner tutorial is free of cost. I divided the entire Power Apps beginner series into 20 different parts.

topItems.title: Power Apps Tutorial for Beginner | The Complete Step by Step Guide to start Power Apps Canvas App
topItems.excerpt: In this video we will learn Microsoft Power Apps Step by step. The series is dedicated for Microsoft Power Apps Beginners. This is the complete start to end Tutorial series for Beginners in Power Apps.  The entire tech series is best resource for Power Apps Beginners Tutorial from Start to End with Real

topItems.title: Introduction to Power Apps | What is Power Apps?
topItems.excerpt: This is the Introduction chapter of Power Apps. Here, we will learn What is Power Apps and why should we choose Power Apps? Also, we will learn how we can build the application using Power Apps. We will walk you through the overview of Power Apps Canvas App, Model Driven App and Portal App as well.

value.title: Beginner Power Apps Topics by April Dunnam
value.excerpt: If you are new to Power Apps then this playlist is for you!  It's full of beginner level Power Apps topics to get you started building low code apps

topItems.title: How to get started with Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #Beginner  The most common question that I'm asked is "I'm new to Power Apps, how do I get started?"  Learning any new technology can be overwhelming.  In this video I list the steps you need to take to start learning Power Apps.  If you are brand new to Power Apps then this is the video to
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-H4ljf4FuTE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Power Apps Data Sources Explained
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #Data  One of the fundamental pieces of Power Apps are data sources.  In this video I explain:  ✅  How Power Apps connects to data ✅  The differences between the types of data sources ✅  Guidance on choosing between tabular data sources (Excel, SharePoint, Dataverse, SQL)  🔗 Links 🔗  🔗

topItems.title: Power Apps Canvas vs Model Driven vs Portals Explained

I'll explain what Power Apps is and go over the three different types of Power Apps that

value.title: Get started using Dataverse
value.excerpt: Do you want to learn how to build solutions that can leverage a standardized data structure and work with other solutions sharing the same data model?  Do you want to extend the standard model to support custom solutions? This learning path will explain the concepts behind and benefits of Dataverse. Creating an environment, entities, fields and options sets are also discussed.

topItems.title: Create and manage environments in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: An environment is a space to store, manage, and share your organization's business data that is stored within an instance of a Common Data Service database.  You can set up one or many environments, depending on the needs of your organization. This module explores these environments and how you can use them with instances of Common Data Service databases.

topItems.title: Get started with Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Common Data Service lets you securely store and manage data that's used by business applications. Standard and custom entities within Common Data Service provide a secure and cloud-based storage option for your data.

topItems.title: Create and manage entities in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Common Data Service entities are similar to tables in a database. Every instance of a Common Data Service database includes a base set of entities that provide structure for data that is commonly used by business applications.

topItems.title: Create and manage fields within an entity in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to create new data fields or leverage exiting standardized fields for your business solutions?  This module will show you how to manage or create new fields within an entity in Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Power App Mutli Screen Form Controls
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #PowerAppsForms  In this video I show how you can break out a form control over multiple screens. This helps provide a better User Experience by reducing scrolling.

topItems.title: Power Apps Timer Value to Hours, Minutes, Seconds
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #TimerControl Have you ever needed to track how long it's taking to complete a process in your Power App? This is an expansion on my "App Makeover: Quick Tips for Beautiful PowerApps" talk

value.title: Get started using Common Data Service
value.excerpt: Do you want to learn how to build solutions that can leverage a standardized data structure and work with other solutions sharing the same data model?  Do you want to extend the standard model to support custom solutions? This learning path will explain the concepts behind and benefits of Common Data Service. Creating an environment, entities, fields and options sets are also discussed.

topItems.title: Create and manage environments in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: An environment is a space to store, manage, and share your organization's business data that is stored within an instance of a Common Data Service database.  You can set up one or many environments, depending on the needs of your organization. This module explores these environments and how you can use them with instances of Common Data Service databases.

topItems.title: Create and manage entities in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Common Data Service entities are similar to tables in a database. Every instance of a Common Data Service database includes a base set of entities that provide structure for data that is commonly used by business applications.

topItems.title: Create and manage fields within an entity in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to create new data fields or leverage exiting standardized fields for your business solutions?  This module will show you how to manage or create new fields within an entity in Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Working with option sets in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to create standardized choice lists that you can use across all of your Power Apps?  This module will show you how to create new or use standard choice lists called option sets in Common Data Service.

value.title: Use best practices to secure and govern Microsoft Power Platform environments
value.excerpt: Learn how you can improve security posture and governance in Microsoft Power Platform.

topItems.title: Introduction to Power Automate security and governance
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to learn about how to help secure and govern Power Platform apps like Power Automate? This module focuses on introducing Power Platform environments and their role in creating Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policies by using examples and use cases. A brief introduction and overview of tools will also be discussed, including Power Platform and Power Automate Admin experiences and the Power Platform Center of Excellence (COE) toolkit.

topItems.title: Plan and manage your Power Automate environment
topItems.excerpt: Every organization has unique requirements based on their size, location, data residency requirements, and desire for democratized access to tools like Power Apps and Power Automate. This module discusses considerations that impact how an organization chooses to secure and govern their Power Platform environments.

topItems.title: Get started with Microsoft Power Platform Center of Excellence
topItems.excerpt: Learn about using Microsoft Power Platform Center of Excellence (CoE) kit in your tenant.

topItems.title: Manage solutions in Power Apps and Power Automate
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage solutions in Microsoft Power Apps and Power Automate.

value.title: Create a canvas app in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Do you want to create apps to help make your business more efficient? Then, this path is for you. It introduces you to Power Apps, helps you create and customize an app, and then manage and distribute it.

topItems.title: Get started with Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of Power Apps and how you can use it in your organization.

topItems.title: Customize a canvas app in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to customize an app by adding controls, images, and logic.

topItems.title: Manage apps in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Manage app versions, app sharing, and environments in Power Apps.

value.title: Mixed Reality in Power Apps by Dhruvin Shah
value.excerpt: Welcome to Power Apps Mixed Reality Step by Step Series. Here, you can learn about the capabilities of Mixed Reality within the Power Apps. This is the Power Apps advanced tutorial series, we will leverage the capability of MR and build our first Mixed Reality App using Power Apps. Here, we will develop our first No-Code Mixed Reality application using the Mixed Reality in Power Apps.

topItems.title: Mixed Reality in Power Apps – Step by Step Series – Part One
topItems.excerpt: Welcome to Power Apps Mixed Reality Step by Step Series. During this video, we will learn how we can use Mixed Reality in Power Apps. I have divided this entire series in 5 different parts. This is the introduction part of this series and we will give you an overview of What is Mixed Reality and how

topItems.title: Mixed Reality in Power Apps – View in 3D Component
topItems.excerpt: During this video, I will demonstrate first Mixed Reality Component which is – “View in 3D”.  With “View in 3D” Component we can view objects in 3D manner. This will add one 3D component on our Power Apps Canvass App screen. This is the experimental feature. We can call this as 3D Viewer or 3D explorer

We can use “View in MR” component in the Power Apps to let users see how a particular item might fit within a specific space. Here, I have

During this video, we will use the “Measure in MR” component to measure Distance, Area, and Volume in Mixed Reality. “Measure

value.title: Administer Power Apps portals
value.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power Apps portals.

topItems.title: Power Apps portals administration
topItems.excerpt: This module will focus on the Microsoft Power Apps Portals administration and using the Power Apps admin center. Additional actions and features are available that you can use to enhance portal functionality.

topItems.title: Integrate Power Apps portals with web-based technologies
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to integrate Power Apps portals with web-based technologies.

topItems.title: Authentication and user management in Power Apps portals
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to authenticate with Power Apps portals.

topItems.title: Power Apps portals maintenance and troubleshooting
topItems.excerpt: When building a Microsoft Power Apps portal, administrators should consider various techniques, best practices, and features. This module will cover the various troubleshooting tools that are available and explain the importance of using the Portal Checker tool.

value.title: Architect solutions for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Becoming a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform.

topItems.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

topItems.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

topItems.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

topItems.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Get Started with Power Apps portals
value.excerpt: Get started creating Power Apps portals.

topItems.title: Introduction to Power Apps portals
topItems.excerpt: Extend Common Data Service interaction to external and internal audiences such as customers, partners, and employees. Use portals to set up an interactive, web-based sales, services, support, and social engagement application platform to connect with customers, engage with communities, manage site content, and empower your channel partners. Empower anyone inside or outside your organization to interact with Common Data Service data by using portals.

topItems.title: Explore Power Apps portals
topItems.excerpt: Dynamics 365 starter portals are pre-configured portal solutions that are available to help accelerate deployment. Typical portal projects will have unique requirements, but a starter portal provides an environment that is immediately suitable for specific scenarios and audiences.

topItems.title: Discover Power Apps portals features
topItems.excerpt: Power Apps portals provide a common set of core features to app makers to build powerful portal applications. Numerous Power Apps features map directly to Microsoft Dynamics 365 apps that are specific to particular business requirements and external audiences. Other Dynamics 365 applications, such as Marketing and Supply Chain Management, also use components of portals or alternate technologies.

topItems.title: Power Apps portals architecture
topItems.excerpt: This module focuses on the Power Apps portals architecture, such as how the various components work together to build a portal. Additionally, it explains how the components are installed and come to together in a working portal. The module also describes the maker and configuration tools that you can use to build and customize Power Apps portals.

value.title: Master advanced techniques for Power Apps canvas apps
value.excerpt: Do you want to make sure your app is the best it can be? This learning path will help you use advanced formulas and perform custom updates. It will also focus on performance checks and testing.

topItems.title: Use imperative development techniques for canvas apps in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use imperative vs. declarative development.

topItems.title: Author an advanced formula that uses tables, records, and collections in a canvas app in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Do you have need for a complex formula in your app? This module can help you author that formula.

topItems.title: Perform custom updates in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: With some Power Apps canvas apps, a form is not the solution.  This module will focus on how to perform custom updates when your data is not in a form.

topItems.title: Complete testing and performance checks in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to test your app and improve it's performance? This module will help you understand how to test an app and improve performance.

value.title: Solution Architect: Design Microsoft Power Platform solutions
value.excerpt: Learn how a solution architect designs solutions.

topItems.title: Solution Architect series: Power Platform architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Microsoft Power Platform architecture.

topItems.title: Solution Architect series: Explore Power Apps architecture
topItems.excerpt: Explore the architecture of Microsoft Power Apps.

topItems.title: Solution Architect series: Evaluate Power Platform analytics and AI
topItems.excerpt: Learn about reporting and analytics in Microsoft Power Platform.

topItems.title: Solution Architect series: Testing and go-live
topItems.excerpt: The solution architect role is continuous; they must also deploy the solution.

value.title: Transform your business applications with fusion development
value.excerpt: Fusion development allows your business to build better applications, faster by bringing together professional developers with citizen, or low-code, developers. This learning path will teach you how a fusion development team functions, introduce low-code concepts for professional developers, and explain how a professional developer can enable their citizen developer counterparts to build amazing Power Apps applications using pro-code tools and frameworks they're already familiar and comfortable with, like JavaScript, ASP.NET Core web APIs, and Azure API Management.

topItems.title: Transform business software authoring with fusion development teams
topItems.excerpt: Increase software development efficiency and productivity with fusion development teams.

topItems.title: Understanding Low Code as a Traditional Developer
topItems.excerpt: Understand Power Fx and how to use it to build an app within Power Apps as a traditional developer

topItems.title: Build a Power Apps component
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to build a custom Power Apps component, create a code component solution package, and then test and debug a code component.

topItems.title: Discover and use Web APIs with Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Build a custom connector using an OpenAPI document or Azure API Management to send data to and receive data from web APIs.

value.title: Use advanced data options and connectors in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Do you want to improve the user's experience in your canvas app? Do you want to use custom connectors to connect to data? This learning path will help you do both things. It will also focus on working with data source limits.

topItems.title: Work with relational data in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to work with relational data in Power Apps canvas apps.

topItems.title: Work with data source limits (delegation limits) in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Delegate data with Power Apps.

topItems.title: Connecting to other data in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to connect to other data in Power Apps canvas app.

topItems.title: Use custom connectors in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use custom connectors in a Power Apps canvas app.

value.title: Work with Power Apps portals
value.excerpt: Work with Power Apps portals.

topItems.title: Explore Power Apps portals Studio
topItems.excerpt: Portal makers spend the majority of their time configuring portals by using Microsoft Power Apps portals Studio. It is important that portal makers have a full understanding of the capabilities and also the limitations of using portals Studio. This module will focus on understanding and using Power Apps portals Studio to create and customize portal websites. Power Apps portals Studio allows makers to add and configure webpages, layout components, static content, custom CSS files, entity lists, and entity forms.

topItems.title: Work with Power Apps portals metadata
topItems.excerpt: Makers are required to understand the various Power Apps portals metadata components so they can configure the portals app for a variety of unique requirements. This module uses the Portal Management app to configure various portals features by editing the portals metadata.

topItems.title: Integrate Power Apps portals with Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: The ability to find and interact with Common Data Service data on a website is one of the core benefits of implementing a Power Apps portal. Several methods are available for you to display Common Data Service data. Learning and knowing about these different options will help you have successful portal implementations. This module will focus on the techniques that you can use to configure entity lists, entity forms, and web forms to build powerful web applications.

topItems.title: Work with Liquid template language in Power Apps portals
topItems.excerpt: Liquid is an [open-source template language](http://dotliquidmarkup.org/?azure-portal=true) that is integrated natively into Microsoft Power Apps portals. It acts as a bridge between Common Data Service and the HTML or text output that is sent to the browser. Liquid can be used to add dynamic content to pages and to create a variety of custom templates. Additionally, Liquid provides access only to the data and operations that are explicitly allowed by the portals.

value.title: One Dev Question on Power Apps
value.excerpt: With Dona Sarkar, who leads an advocacy team for the Power Platform.

topItems.title: What are the benefits of Power Apps for professional developers? | One Dev Question: Dona Sarkar
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Principal Cloud Advocate Dona Sarkar shares why Power Apps is important for professional developers.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/getting-started/?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-donasa    Try Azure for free: https://aka.ms/TryAzure7

topItems.excerpt: Sometimes services like Power Apps can be daunting. In the One Dev Question series, Principal Cloud Advocate Dona Sarkar shares some tips for getting started and explains why you do not have to be a professional developer to use Power Apps.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/modules/get-started-with-powerapps/?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-donasa

topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Principal Cloud Advocate Dona Sarkar gives some advice on creating Power App solutions.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/get-started-test-drive/?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-donasa   Try Azure for free: https://aka.ms/TryAzure7

value.title: Create components with Power Apps Component Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how to build custom components and controls with Power Apps component framework.

topItems.title: Build a Power Apps component
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to build a custom Power Apps component, create a code component solution package, and then test and debug a code component.

value.title: Create a model-driven application in Power Apps
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to creating a model-driven app in Power Apps that uses Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Introduction to model-driven apps and Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to quickly build apps with little to no code? This module will focus on the building blocks of Common Data Service and model-driven apps. These key components will help you build quick business apps in your organization.

topItems.title: Get started with Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Common Data Service lets you securely store and manage data that's used by business applications. Standard and custom entities within Common Data Service provide a secure and cloud-based storage option for your data.

topItems.title: Get started with model-driven apps in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Model-driven app design is an approach that focuses on quickly adding components to your apps. These components include dashboards, forms, views, and charts. With no code, or very little, you can make apps that are simple or very complex. Unlike in canvas app development, where the designer has total control over the app layout, much of the layout in model-driven apps is determined by the components you add. In other words, the emphasis is more on quickly viewing your business data and making decisions than on intricate app design.

value.title: Create apps, chatbots, flows, and more with Microsoft Dataverse and Teams
value.excerpt: Learn how to create apps, flows, and more with Microsoft Dataverse for Teams

topItems.title: Get started with Microsoft Dataverse for Teams
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces Microsoft Dataverse for Teams and how you can build apps, workflows, chatbots, and dashboards in it. You will learn how to provision Dataverse for Teams and then create a table for your data.

topItems.title: Build your first app with Power Apps and Dataverse for Teams
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to build an app by using Microsoft Dataverse for Teams.

value.title: Manage permissions and administration for Common Data Service
value.excerpt: Do you need to manage user access rights? In this learning path, you will learn how to manage permissions associated with environments and entities.  You will also learn about different administrative portals and how to access each.

topItems.title: Get started with security roles in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to use security roles to limit user permissions? This module will show you how you can set permissions to limit access to an environment or limit which users can view, edit, or delete data in an environment within Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Use administration options for Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you need to use administration options that are available for Common Data Service? This module will show you how you can use solutions within Common Data Service and administer environments.

value.title: Manage permissions and administration for Dataverse
value.excerpt: Do you need to manage user access rights? In this learning path, you will learn how to manage permissions associated with environments and entities.  You will also learn about different administrative portals and how to access each.

topItems.title: Get started with security roles in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to use security roles to limit user permissions? This module will show you how you can set permissions to limit access to an environment or limit which users can view, edit, or delete data in an environment within Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Use administration options for Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you need to use administration options that are available for Common Data Service? This module will show you how you can use solutions within Common Data Service and administer environments.

value.title: Use basic formulas to make better Power Apps canvas apps
value.excerpt: Do you want to use formulas to improve functionality and change a behavior in your Power Apps canvas app? This learning path can help you accomplish your goal.

topItems.title: Author a basic formula to change properties in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Want to enhance your Power Apps canvas app? You can use basic formulas to make changes to control properties.  This will include changing the format, position, simple calculations, and implementing conditional formatting.

topItems.title: Author a basic formula to change behaviors in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to author a basic formula to change behaviors in a Power Apps canvas app.

topItems.title: Author a basic formula that uses tables and records in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to author a basic formula that uses tables and records in a Power Apps canvas app.

value.title: Use the UI and controls in a canvas app in Power Apps
value.excerpt: The app user experience often defines the success of your app. This learning path will focus on how to provide the best app navigation, and build the best UI using themes, icons, images, personalization, different form factors, and controls.

topItems.title: Navigation in a canvas app in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: App users can only navigate through the navigation options provided by an app developer, and this module is designed to help you build a good navigation experience for your canvas app.

topItems.title: How to build the UI in a canvas app in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to build a better UI for app users? This module helps you do that using themes, icons, images, personalization, different form factors, and controls.

topItems.title: Use and understand Controls in a canvas app in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Controls help create a better experience for the user and collect the appropriate data. This module will help you understand and use Controls.
